Welcome to dz11’s documentation!¶

REST api Contacts main¶

REST api Contacts database DB¶

REST api Contacts repository Contacts¶

async dz11.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Receive the request body

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async dz11.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶
The get_contact function returns a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be returned. user (User): The user who owns the requested Contact object. db (Session): A database session for querying and updating data in a relational database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact that we want to get

  • user – User: Get the user id from the logged in user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The first contact in the database that matches a user’s id and a contact_id

Doc-author:

Trelent

async dz11.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, name: str, surname: str, email: str, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts in the list

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • name – str: Filter the contacts by name

  • surname – str: Filter the contacts by surname

  • email – str: Filter the contacts by email

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async dz11.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. user (User): The user who owns the contacts list. db (Session): A connection to our database, used for querying and deleting data.

Returns:

Contact or None: If successful, returns a Contact object representing the deleted record; otherwise returns None.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact that is to be removed

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object or none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async dz11.repository.contacts.upcoming_birthdays(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶
The upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next 7 days.
Args:

user (User): The user who owns the contacts. db (Session): A database session to query for upcoming birthdays.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async dz11.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactModel): The updated Contact object to be stored in the database. user (User): The current logged-in user, used for authorization purposes. db (Session): A connection to our SQLite3 database, used for querying and updating data.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact that we want to update

  • body – ContactModel: Get the new contact information from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user id of the logged in user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent
